title: Radar Roundup: Gravel Bikes Galore – Team Amani OSTRO, Canyon Grizl CF SL 7 Throwback, Hudski Doggler EVO, Waveform Colors, Recon ADV,  Revel Rodeo, and Tour de France Women
content:
Our Radar Roundup compiles products and videos from the ‘net in an easy-to-digest format. Read on below for today’s findings…

Factor Bikes: The Team Amani OSTRO

The Amani OSTRO Gravel design was based on the colors found in the landscapes of the Rift Valley in Kenya and plays off the Team Amani kit colors for 2023. The stylized print for the forks contrasts the main body colors and is based on a Cheetah print pattern. Cheetahs are found throughout the Maasai Mara National Reserve, Rift Valley Province in Kenya and are a true symbol of speed and athleticism, not unlike the riders on Team Amani. The design is playfully bold and represents the spirit of the East African riders.

Specs:

  • FRAME: TeXtreme®, Toray®, Nippon Graphite® Pitch-Based Fiber
  • FORK: OSTRO Wide Stance Fork
  • SEATPOST: 0 and 20mm setback available
  • BARSTEM: Black Inc Aero Bartsem Reach 80mm, drop 120mm. Multiple stem lengths and bar widths available
  • HEADSET: CeramicSpeed 1.5″ bearings
  • HEAD TUBE DIAMETER: 1.5″ upper and lower
  • BOTTOM BRACKET: CeramicSpeed T47A Aluminium cups / CeramicSpeed bearings with Wheels MFG 24mm BBRight Reducers / Adapters
  • MAX TIRE CLEARANCE: 45mm
  • WHEEL SIZE: 700c
  • BRAKE TYPE: Disc
  • FRONT AXLE: 12 x 100mm thru-axle
  • REAR AXLE: 12 x 142mm thru-axle
  • CABLE ROUTING: Internal
  • MANUFACTURER WARRANTY: Limited Lifetime Warranty
  • GROUPSET: SRAM RED XPLR / SRAM Force XPLR 44t chainring and 10-44 cassette / SRAM Red / SRAM Force eTap
  • AXS with a 46/33, 10-33 set up.

See more at Factor Bikes.

Canyon Grizl CF SL 7 Throwback

Canyon leans into the phrase “gravel bikes are just XC bikes from the 90s” with this new limited edition Grizl build kit. While this looks like a standard Canyon build kit, those DT Swiss shot-peened finished wheels look great. Check out more at Canyon.

Read Amanda’s review of the Grizl in our archives: Amanda’s Custom Flashpoint MVMNT Canyon Grizl Gravel Bike

Hudski Doggler EVO $1600

The Hudski Doggler has a cult following of people who use theirs to commute on, ride gravel, bike tour, hit some singletrack and more. Now the team is offering up these versatile frames with a Fox 32 gravel fork. Nothing changed in terms of frame spec because the fork doesn’t alter the geometry all that much…

Doggler EVO Build

  • Doggler Frame- Alloy
  • Fox 32TC Fork- Factory Series
    32mm Stanchion- Kashima Coat
    Fox FIT4

    • Wheel Size: 700c
    • Travel: 40mm
    • Rake: 45mm
    • Axle: Kabolt 12 x 100mm
    • Rotor Size: 160 direct Flat Mount, up to 180 compatible
  • Wolf Tooth Components Seat Post Collar- 34.9mm
  • Wolf Tooth Components Rear Thru Axle- 12 x 142mm
  • *Headset NOT included*

See more at Hudski Bikes.

Wolf Tooth Waveform Pedals in New Colors $199.95

The new Wolf Tooth Waveform Aluminum Pedals are designed for all-mountain riding, from XC to downhill. These pedals are engineered to provide a supportive platform for power transfer while also cradling and locking your feet in place – even in wet, muddy, or snowy conditions.  The latest product from Wolf Tooth comes in eight colors and two sizes.

  • Shaped with purpose: The shape of Waveform Aluminum Pedals matches the footprint of your shoe.
  • Dual-concave profile: Pedals are 14mm thick at the perimeter and just 12.5mm thick in the center
  • Extra grip: Each side features 11 stainless-steel rear-loading pins for enhanced shoe grip
  • Reliable performance: Internal components are protected against all trail conditions
  • Two sizes: Large (112mm x 106mm) and Small (105mm x 99mm)
  • Eight colors: espresso, olive, red, and raw silver join the existing black, orange, blue, and ultraviolet purple

Wolf Tooth believes in the Right to Repair. All components of Waveform Aluminum Pedals are available as replacement parts, including the pedal body, stainless steel axle, bearings, and more.

See more at Wolf Tooth

Specialized Recon ADV Shoe $225

Look good, feel good, ride good – and adage as old as cycling itself… That’s the idea behind the new Recon ADV, where riding in style is just as important as the actual ride. Recon ADV is suited for the rider who values adventure, time on the bike, and needs an all-day shoe that will keep going when the gravel ends. Recon ADV’s excellent walkability is made possible by STRIDE toe flex technology, providing a more natural feeling for off-the-bike adventuring.

  • STRIDE toe flex technology allows greater toe flex for steep inclines and improved walkability
  • Laser perforated upper features microfiber backing for better moisture management and supple feeling
  • Ride or hike in confidence with a TPU mudguard that offers protection from stone strikes
  • Pontoons create a stable pedal platform as well as aiding walking feel
  • Greater SlipNot rubber tread coverage on sole that’s optimized for gravel traction
  • Features proven Body Geometry technology like the Varus Wedge to maintain efficient and comfortable hip, knee, and foot alignment while riding

See more at Specialized

Revel Bikes Releases the Rodeo

This week, Revel Bikes introduced the “Rodeo”, the world’s first fully 3D-printed carbon fiber bike. While, yes this is a downhill bike, and a conceptual one at that, the Revel Rodeo is a multi-year passion project of Adam Miller (Revel Bikes), Chris Canfield (CBF suspension inventor), and Jordan Haffener (Revel Bikes Senior Engineer). The Rodeo was designed by Revel and manufactured in partnership with 3D Printing pioneer, Arevo Inc. While purely a concept bike and not currently for sale, the Rodeo exists as a groundbreaking example of what is possible with modern additive manufacturing and a handful of extremely passionate people in the Bicycle Industry.

Women Return to Cycling’s Biggest Stage

After more than 30 years of absence, women returned to the famous multi-day stage race in France in 2022, and stepped back onto the largest stage in cycling. Cannondale sponsored three of the 24 teams that entered the event. We filmed it all.

More Than a Race – our documentary on what happened – debuts March 14.
